data.title: Great Bar - Friendly Staff
data.text:
This is a great bar to hang out and have a drink in the Center of Ocala.
The bar staff are super friendly and the choice of beers is great. They has a pumpkin beer which is the best i've ever had.

data.title: Best bar in Ocala
data.text: A great place to go hang out with friends or to meet new people. It's not too loud and crazy but a great relaxing enjoyable environment with good food and drink. It has an artsy feel with lots of games and fun things to do and owner Algenard is one of the coolest people you'll meet. If you haven't gone here before you definitely should at least go once if you're ever in the area.

data.title: Great place to hang out with friends, good selection of beer
data.text: One of our go to places when we hang out with friends and other couples. Always fun playing board games and having a few drinks. Always find a new beer or something in a bottle i have never tried and have been surprised when some cool beers show up here. They also have wine. Good place to hang out, relax and have a drink.

data.title: Great local hang out!
data.text: This place has awesome board and card games, and people always willing to meat you and play them with you. They play lively music, and have a full bar and the bar tenders are SUPER FRIENDLY. The  special events are always AWESOME fun. NOTE:: This is a bar that serves food. If you're looking for a swanky sit down dinner, you probably want to walk  to a nearby restaurant. The tapas here are always fantastic, so if you have an open mind, want a drink and something yummy to munch you will have a GREAT time here!!!

data.title: What a joke! And apparently they don't want new customers.
data.text: Wow. I cannot believe the attitude of this place! I asked a simple question about a vegetarian option on one of their event pages (a logical question at an eating establishment) and not only did they allow me to repeatedly be attacked by a small-minded customer, but they actually defended that person. To top it off, they couldn't even answer my question about the ingredients of their non-homemade soup (how hard is it to make your own soup, really? so lazy) and they put the onus on ME to find out for myself. The Courtyard on Broadway is an absolute joke!

data.title: Lots of old fashion fun here!
data.text: They offer all kinds of board games, card games, game stations, and a projector screen which is great for parties too. They have lots of space to hold baby showers, birthdays, or wedding parties. The beer is always ice cold too!

data.title: Unique place
data.text: The Courtyard is a very unique place.  There are board games to play and gather with friends.  Nice and clean

data.title: vibrant, casual, easy, not threatening,
data.text: Populated by young, sorta professional, 25-35 crowd, this place is neat, with an atmosphere that is not like most bars. No drunken guys hitting on the other folks. While not much in the atmosphere department, it makes up for it in the friendly sector.

data.title: Different environment, wide drink selection, fun events
data.text:
This isnt your normal bar scene.  Its for the grown-up, yet sophisticated, kid in you.  The layout is large enough to not be cramped and there is also outside seating with two fire pits.

The beer selection is about 8 drafts at all times combined with an additional 20 or so bottled beers, and wine too.  They also serve light food - Tapas, as they call them.

One really neat thing about this place is that there are tons of board games.  Anything from Connect Four to Hungry, Hungry Hippos to even Massive Jenga or Cards Against Humanity.

There is plenty of indoor seating and the place is air conditioned... which is really important come summer time.

Also, they are always doing neat events every week.  Usually on Fridays (or at least in the past) they will do $0.50 or $1 draft beers from 5pm till 9pm.  Some weeks they dont do it, but its usually sponsored by a local business.  Also, they have featured parties like 80's night, New Years Eve party or other themed events.

data.title: The People make the Place
data.text: great atmosphere to have a few drinks, play some games and take in some local artwork. There is plenty of fun to be had there, especially with friends. It's more of a family friendly, low key kind of bar. The owner and staff are all great people who make me want to hang out there all day. Last Summer I did live model art classes there which was really fun. They host a lot of really cool events and party's there as well.

data.title: The Courtyard on Broadway--Bar
data.text: A newly opened bar. Had incredible paintings on wall. Also has an ongoing painting for customers to leave their print behind.  Past time games on all the tables such as, Operation, Connect Four, Rock em Sock em Robots and many more. Or, enjoy some karaoke. Owner, Al was friendly and attentive.  I wish him luck on his new adventure and was so happy to have found his bar.
